channel.title: BBC News - Science & Environment

item.title: Climate change: At-risk nations fear extinction after IPCC report
item.description: The most vulnerable developing countries plead for action after a stark warning from a UN panel.

item.title: Climate change: IPCC report is 'code red for humanity'
item.description: Heating from humans has caused irreparable damage to the Earth that may get worse in coming decades.

item.title: Climate change: Five things we have learned from the IPCC report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: Artificial Intelligence may diagnose dementia in a day
item.description: The system being tested should spot the disease long before symptoms or obvious brain signs develop.

item.title: Extreme weather: How it is connected to climate change?
item.description: Heatwaves, wildfires, floods and droughts highlight how extreme weather is linked to climate change.

item.title: Climate change: Make coal history says PM after climate warning
item.description: Boris Johnson calls for a shift towards clean energy sources after "sobering" report on climate change.

item.title: Greece wildfires: Evia island residents forced to evacuate
item.description: Hundreds on the island of Evia flee to safety by sea as a record heatwave sparks devastating fires.

item.title: Earth Photo 2021 winners announced
item.description: A project on family education wins the 2021 Earth Photo competition.

item.title: Climate change: Time running out to stop catastrophe - Alok Sharma
item.description: Despite his warning, the Tory climate chief does not rule out future fossil fuel projects in the UK.

item.title: Climate change: Low-income countries 'can't keep up' with impacts
item.description: Officials warn that the severity of natural disasters is outpacing efforts to prevent their damage.

item.title: COP26: Minister says summit must be a turning point
item.description: Zac Goldsmith says COP26 must be a "turning point", despite warnings that costs of tackling climate change will hit poor families.

item.title: Why China's climate policy matters to us all
item.description: The global battle against climate change is likely to be won or lost in China.

item.title: The activist entrepreneurs running zero-waste shops
item.description: Environmentally conscious entrepreneurs explain the movement towards zero-waste lifestyles.

item.title: Then and now: The burning issue of wildfires
item.description: Scientists are increasingly concerned climate change is making fires more frequent and more intense.

item.title: UK military opens first space command centre
item.description: The new operations centre will help the UK maintain a "battle-winning advantage", ministers say.

item.title: Boeing's Starliner spacecraft: A guide
item.description: Starliner is one of two vehicles designed to transport astronauts to and from the space station.

item.title: Russian module mishap destabilises International Space Station
item.description: The ISS was pushed out of position after engines on a new Russian module unexpectedly fired up.

item.title: Bezos' $2bn offer to get back in race to the Moon
item.description: The billionaire offers to cover $2bn in Nasa costs to be reconsidered for a Moon lander contract.

item.title: Why whales in Alaska have been so happy
item.description: What will happen to Alaska's whales when tourism returns to waters stilled by Covid?

item.title: Mayflower 400 years: How many people are related to the Mayflower pilgrims?
item.description: For some, the17th century "pilgrim fathers" are also real-life ancestors. But for how many?

item.title: Why artificial intelligence is being used to write adverts
item.description: Advertisers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to come up with their winning slogans.

item.title: Scuba-diver photographs Scotland's colourful marine life
item.description: Scuba-diver Ross McLaren has taken thousands of photos of marine life in Scotland's rivers and sea-lochs.

item.title: Extreme weather: What causes flash flooding?
item.description: Cities across the world are at risk of extreme rainfall overwhelming their streets

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Finding answers to the world's drinking water crisis
item.description: Scientists are racing to come up with technologies that can solve the world's clean water shortage.

item.title: The new surgical tool inspired by a wasp
item.description: The device avoids clogging by using friction instead of suction, similar to the way a parasitoid wasp lays its eggs.

item.title: Is there a future for Africa's lions?
item.description: As lion populations decline across much of Africa, could community-led conservation help reverse this trend?

item.title: AI breakthrough could spark medical revolution
item.description: A program has been used to predict the structures of nearly every protein in the human body.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: 'Jurassic Pompeii' yields thousands of 'squiggly wiggly' fossils
item.description: Scientists are excavating one of the most important Jurassic sites ever discovered in the UK.
